intro: Oliverodoxa curviflora, commonly known as the curling flower, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, spiraling inflorescence that gives it its common name. The plant features delicate, waxy petals that range in color from pale pink to deep red, depending on the species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its limited habitat and slow growth, Oliverodoxa curviflora is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
